  • Internal timers

Internal timers¶

DesignWare® ARC® processors have two independent 32-bit timers and a 64-bit real-time counter (RTC). Timer 0 and Timer 1 are identical in operation. The only difference is that these timers are connected to different interrupts. Each timer is optional with a fixed interrupt: interrupt 16 for timer 0 and interrupt 17 for timer 1.

The internal timers are connected to a system clock signal that always runs even when the ARC EM processor is in the SLEEP state. The timers can be used to generate interrupt signals that wake the processor from the SLEEP state. The processor timers automatically reset and restart after reaching the limit value. The processor timers can be programmed to count the clock cycles only if the processor is not halted. The processor timers can also be programmed to generate an interrupt or a system reset if they reach the limit value. The 64-bit RTC cannot generate any interrupts. This timer is used to count the clock cycles automatically.

embARC BSP provides interfaces for internal timers such as start, stop, poll, and read.

API Reference¶

group ARC_HAL_MISC_TIMER

ARC internal timer management.

The processor timers include two independent 32-bit timers and a 64-bit real-time counter (RTC). Timer 0 and timer 1 are identical in operation. The only difference is that these timers are connected to different interrupts. The Timers cannot be included in a configuration without interrupts. Each timer is optional and when present, it is connected to a fixed interrupt; interrupt 16 for timer 0 and interrupt 17 for timer 1. The processor timers are connected to a system clock signal that operates even when the ARCv2-based processor is in the sleep state. The timers can be used to generate interrupt signals that wake the processor from SLEEP state.

The processor timers automatically reset and restart their operation after reaching the limit value. The processor timers can be programmed to count only the clock cycles when the processor is not halted. The processor timers can also be programmed to generate an interrupt or to generate a system Reset upon reaching the limit value.

The 64-bit RTC does not generate any interrupts. This timer is used to count the clock cycles automatically.

arc internal timers names

TIMER_0¶

macro name for arc internal timer 0

TIMER_1¶

macro name for arc internal timer 1

TIMER_RTC¶

macro name for arc internal RTC

SECURE_TIMER_0¶

macro name for arc internal secure timer 0

SECURE_TIMER_1¶

macro name for arc internal secure timer 1

bit definition of RTC CTRL reg

TIMER_RTC_ENABLE¶

enable RTC

TIMER_RTC_CLEAR¶
TIMER_RTC_STATUS_A0¶

track bit of atomicity of reads of RTC

TIMER_RTC_STATUS_A1¶

track bit of atomicity of reads of RTC

bit definition of timer CTRL reg

TIMER_CTRL_IE¶

Interrupt when count reaches limit

TIMER_CTRL_NH¶

Count only when CPU NOT halted

TIMER_CTRL_W¶

watchdog enable

TIMER_CTRL_IP¶

interrupt pending

Defines

INTNO_TIMER0¶
INTNO_TIMER1¶
INTNO_SECURE_TIMER0¶
INTNO_SECURE_TIMER1¶

Functions

int32_t arc_timer_present(const uint32_t no)¶

Check whether the specific timer present.

Return

1 present, 0 not present

Parameters

  • no: Timer number

int32_t arc_timer_start(const uint32_t no, const uint32_t mode, const uint32_t val)¶

Start a timer.

Return

0 success, -1 failure

Parameters

  • no: Timer number

  • mode: Timer mode

  • val: Timer limit value (not for RTC)

int32_t arc_timer_stop(const uint32_t no)¶

Stop timer.

Return

0 success, -1 failure

Parameters

  • no: Timer number

int32_t arc_timer_current(const uint32_t no, void *val)¶

Get timer current tick.

Return

0 success, -1 failure

Parameters

  • no: Timer number

  • val: Timer current tick value

int32_t arc_timer_int_clear(const uint32_t no)¶

Clear the interrupt pending bit of timer.

Return

0 success, -1 failure

Parameters

  • no: Timer number

void arc_timer_int(void)¶

Initialize internal timer.

void arc_delay_us(uint32_t usecs)¶

Function for delaying execution for number of microseconds.

Parameters

  • usecs: Number of us

uint64_t arc_timer_calibrate_delay(uint32_t cpu_clock)¶

Get calibration values for a given cpu clock source.

Return

loops_per_jiffy Calibration value

Parameters

  • cpu_clock: board CPU clock source to calibrate
